key_channel_insights.line_content: Over 95% of fares are higher on OTA, with minimal undercuts under 1%. Visibility gaps are seen especially in long-haul markets.
MSE fares remain predominantly lower than the website, near 98%, though a small higher segment is emerging under 1%.
GDS fares show a strong premium at about 97% higher than the website, with minimal N/A and under 1% lower cases.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Over 95% of itineraries show higher fares on the OTA than on the website, a slight rise from last month.
OTA-lower fares remain below 1% across dimensions, with a continued decline relative to last month.
For long-haul flights, “Website offer not found” reaches 4%, nearly double the previous month’s level.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Website offer not found is around 2% overall, peaking at 4% for long haul. Volumes dropped by up to 46% from last month.
Identical pricing is below 2% overall but reaches roughly 10% in long-haul segments. Levels declined 39% from last week.
Cheaper OTA fares remain under 1%. Frequencies fell about 46% from last month.
Over 95% of fares are higher on the OTA, exceeding 97% in short haul. This share rose by up to 2% since last month.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: OTA-higher fares account for 98% last week, up from 97% previously. Minimal OTA N/A or OTA-lower activity.
OTA-higher fares are at 85%. Website offer not found is more common at 4%, rising from about 2.6% last month.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 98.5% of fares are higher on OTA, nearly 1% more than last week. Website offer not found remains near 1%.
Roughly 95% of itineraries price higher on OTA. OTA-lower fares hover at around 0.4%.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: About 95% show higher OTA fares, up 0.9% from last week. OTA N/A frequency is near 2.3%, mostly stable.
Over 98% of fares run higher on OTA with minimal change week to week. OTA-lower remains under 0.3%.

mse_highlights.line_content: Nearly all fares are lower than the website, with about 98% in the last week.
Channel-lower frequency dipped slightly from 98% to 96% versus last month.
MSE-higher fares remain below 1% but increased from 0% to 0.6% over the month.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Less than 1% of offers are missing on MSE and fluctuating minimally around 0.8%.
Only about 1–2% match website pricing, down from 2.5% last month.
Below 1% of fares exceed website prices, showing a slight rise from last week’s zero.
Dominates at around 98% last week, easing to 97% weekly and 96% monthly.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 98% remain cheaper via MSE, dipping two points over the month. MSE-higher stays under 1% but rising.
Lower share fell from 96% to 91% weekly and 90.8% monthly; 'Same' rose from 3.6% to 7.8%.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Nearly 99% cheaper on MSE last week, tempering to 97% monthly. MSE-higher edged up from 0% to 1.3%.
Mostly cheaper (97% LW to 95% monthly). MSE-higher stayed low at 0.2% but grew from zero.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: About 98% cheaper last week, dipping to 95% monthly. Higher fares grew to just under 1%.
Remains 98% cheaper with minor fluctuations. No notable MSE-higher trend observed.

gds_highlights.line_content: Over 95% of itineraries are priced higher in GDS, indicating a strong premium versus the airline website.
GDS-lower is under 1%, and SAME remains near 1%, signaling limited parity or lower positioning.
Website fares not found in GDS are under 2% and trending slightly down from last month.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Around 1–2% of fares missing in GDS, showing a notable drop from the previous month of nearly 76%.
Hovers just above 1%, with negligible change week over week or month over month.
Represents the bulk at roughly 97% share, slightly up versus last month.
Remains below 1%, dipping marginally from last week and month.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Nearly 98% of short-haul fares are higher in GDS, leaving minimal room for same or lower price points.
GDS-higher is about 87%, with a more notable 9% share for same pricing versus the website.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: GDS-higher commands roughly 98.6% share, overshadowing all other statuses.
GDS-higher is around 95.4%, slightly lower than NO, with a minor uptick in GDS-lower cases.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Nearly 96% of close-in itineraries are GDS-higher, holding steady across weeks.
About 98.4% are GDS-higher, with a slight increase from the previous week indicating a growing premium.
